xenoData

xenoDatanon-TEI metadata provides a container element into which metadata in non-TEI formats may be placed. [2.5 Non-TEI Metadata ]
Moduleheader â€” The TEI header
Attributes
  • att.global ( @xml:id, @n, @xml:lang, @xml:base, @xml:space ) (att.global.rendition ( @rend, @style, @rendition ) ) (att.global.linking ( @corresp, @synch, @sameAs, @copyOf, @next, @prev, @exclude, @select ) ) (att.global.analytic ( @ana ) ) (att.global.facs ( @facs ) ) (att.global.change ( @change ) ) (att.global.responsibility ( @cert, @resp ) ) (att.global.source ( @source ) )
  • att.declarable ( @default )
  • att.typed ( @type, @subtype )
    • Member ofmodel.teiHeaderPart
    Contained by

    header

    :
    • teiHeader
    May contain
    Character Data
    Example

    This example presumes that the prefix dc has been bound to the namespace http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/ and the prefix rdf is bound to the namespace http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#. Note: The about attribute on the rdf:Description in this example gives a URI indicating the resource to which the metadata contained therein refer. The rdf:Description in the second xenoData block has a blank about, meaning it is pointing at the current document, so the RDF is about the document within which it is contained, i.e. the TEI document containing the xenoData block. Similarly, any kind of relative URI may be used, including fragment identifiers (see 5.6.2 Identifiers and Indicators). Do note, however, that if the contents of the xenoData block are to be extracted and used elsewhere, any relative URIs will have to be resolved accordingly.

    <xenoData> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"><rdf:Description rdf:about="http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/606621663"><dc:title xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">The description of a new world, called the blazing-world</dc:title> <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">The Duchess of Newcastle</dc:creator> <dc:date xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">1667</dc:date> <dc:identifier xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">British Library, 8407.h.10</dc:identifier> <dc:subject xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">utopian fiction</dc:subject></rdf:Description></rdf:RDF> </xenoData> <xenoData> <rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#"><rdf:Description rdf:about=""><dc:title xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">The Description of a New World, Called the Blazing-World, 1668</dc:title> <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Cavendish, Margaret (Lucas), Duchess of Newcastle</dc:creator> <dc:publisher xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Women Writers Project</dc:publisher> <dc:date xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">2002-02-12</dc:date> <dc:subject xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">utopian fiction</dc:subject></rdf:Description></rdf:RDF> </xenoData>
